CatDescriptText: Portion of related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper August 1, 1942, pg. 9, reads: "Dorothy, the third of the trio, will marry Monday. [Illegible] ...Anderson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Anderson... [ill.] (Louise Douglass), pledges her troth to Hubert Sharpe, son of the late Hubert and Francina Shape in the... [ill.] of (downtown) Trinity Cathedral. The nuptial...[ill.] at high noon, and as we go to press, there is a... [ill.] and bustle of photographers and reporters trying... [ill.] hand for the ceremony. Dorothy, a beautiful... [ill.] with long black silken hair, will make a lovely bride...[ill.] Hubert, tall and stately, will certainly be the handsome... [ill.]charming..."
TitMainTitle: Wedding party with three women, including bride Dorothy Anderson Sharpe wearing gown with long train spread before her, and two men, including groom Hubert Sharpe, posed on lawn
